PM Linehaul Allocator

Company Name Toll People Company Location Tullamarine, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Who are we?


The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, generating annual revenue of AU$8.3 billion and employing over 40,000 people across an extensive network of 1,200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world. We're committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent.


The opportunity?


As part of Toll Group's new growth strategy an exciting opportunity has arisen for a PM Linehaul Allocator to join our growing Linehaul division. Reporting to the Contractor Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for load planning and allocation to ensure the effective and efficient utilisation of the company and contractor fleet on a minimum cost basis.


Your responsibilities will include, but not limited to:

  • Conducting capacity planning to ensure adequate equipment is available to deliver the supply plan
  • Ensuring resource utilisation is maximised to deliver optimal customer service in a cost efficient manner
  • Possessing a strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritise workload
  • Understanding the national network of the Linehaul business to achieve best possible outcomes in terms of customer service, reliability and cost
  • Following all safety work procedures, adhering to all safety guidelines provided


The ideal candidate?


The successful candidate will have previous experience within the transport industry planning and allocating a large fleet or worked in a similar capacity. Having an understanding of various transport legislation, OHS legislation and load restraints is also essential for this role. You will be analytical in your approach and have excellent communications and organisational skills and be able to work in a high pressured environment.


For a confidential discussion regarding the role please contact Solomon Samson, Toll People, 03 9049 4013.


We will not be liable for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited CVs sent directly to line managers from recruitment agencies.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Logistics and Supply Chain
  • Transportation/Trucking/Railroad

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Supply Chain

Critical Care Nurse - Intensive Care Unit

Company Name Epworth Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Leading world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group
  • Strong focus on patient centred care, research and education
  • Box Hill location, plans for future growth

Epworth Eastern

Located in Box Hill, Epworth Eastern is a state-of-the-art facility and includes a 8 bed ICU, 10 bed HDU/CCU and 10 theatres.

Epworth Eastern maintains a broad clinical focus from cardiac, vascular, orthopaedic and general surgery to oncology, urology and endoscopy services. From consultation and detection through to surgery, Epworth Eastern aims to work with patients and their families to ensure they have the best experience possible.

In 2018, the commencement of Epworth Eastern’s expansion and redevelopment project will grow the hospital and introduce a brand new emergency department to the region.

The Role

We are seeking experienced Critical Care Registered Nurses to join our dynamic team, who wish to be involved in providing excellence in clinical care within the Intensive Care Unit environment at Epworth Eastern. Our Intensive Care Unit (ICU) is a combined general ICU, high dependency and telemetry unit and is renowned for its friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere along with excellent care that is delivered to its patients.

Key areas of focus for this role include-
  • Delivering an exceptional patient experience within the Intensive Care Unit
  • Ensuring patient flow is managed whilst providing high standards of patient care
  • Encouraging and role-modelling empathy to patients, families and medical consultants


Skills & Experience

To be successful in the role you will-
  • Hold current nursing registration with AHPRA
  • Have completed or working towards a Post Graduate qualification in Critical/Intensive Care Nursing
  • Be currently employed in a critical care setting
  • Be able to demonstrate nursing experience in a critical care area
  • Be highly accountable and demonstrate a strong, supportive and engaging style
  • Be passionate about patient care and achieving high quality clinical outcomes


About Epworth

Epworth HealthCare is a world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group dedicated to providing the best possible outcomes for our patients by providing the best possible care. Across our eight locations patients and staff have access to state-of-the-art diagnostic, surgical and procedural technology, world-class theatres and equipment and benefit from the extensive teaching and research occurring at Epworth every day.

The Epworth Difference is defined by our unique culture and dedication to giving outstanding patient care. From the way we recognise and reward our staff to our attitude toward the patient experience, Epworth is for those with the ambition to get better, give the best possible care and lead their field.

Epworth is a great choice for staff who want to be part of a cutting-edge, fast paced and progressive environment.

Enquire/Apply for this Position

To obtain more information refer to the attached position description.

Direct your enquiries to the contact person listed below.

Applications must be submitted online – to apply for this position click Apply Now

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Epworth and a valid employee Working with Children Check to be provided by the applicant.

Note- Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted.

Associate

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Medical Practice
  • Hospital & Health Care

Security Assurance Partner

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location Docklands, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The Security Confidence and Risk (SCR) team is part of the nbn Security Group and operates nbn's security risk & assurance program ensuring nbn assurance obligations are met while providing confidence to management that assets have the appropriate protections in place.


In your new role, you will be reporting to the Manager, Security Assurance and Risk. You will be responsible for executing the security assurance program and services consistently and collaboratively across nbn, as well as to ensure the successful delivery of security related business outcomes in both project and production environments.


A bit about your role


Outlined below are the core duties that the Security Assurance Partner will be responsible for delivering:

  • Delivering security assurance activities; using security assurance methodology and tools to identify security issues and risks
  • Contributing to security risk reporting
  • Technical security testing across infrastructure, application and network platforms
  • Identifying security risks and insights
  • Improving security assurance methodology and tools
  • Contributing to the continuous improvement of security assurance capabilities, including input into key initiatives and problem-solving exercises


A bit about you


We are looking for someone with sufficient experience in Security and Risk Management fields or similar. You will have completed a tertiary degree in Security/IT/Computer Science or Commerce. Ideally you will have experience in delivery security assurance engagements, including end-to-end scoping; fieldwork and reporting of IT audits and/or IT risk assessments.


As an individual, you will be able to deal with ambiguity and have a solid technical understanding of security threats as well as the ability to translate them into business context. Excellent stakeholder management skills will assist you to succeed in this role, including the ability to influence without direct authority.


Life at nbn


At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.


Continue the conversation


If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.


nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!


At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn™ network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

Industry

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

Job description

The role

In this role you will be required to provide commercial insight and financial support for the development and launch of new businesses/product lines.

To Be Successful, You’ll Have
  • strong leadership and coaching skills
  • the ability to manage multiple priorities in a high pressure and challenging environment
  • advanced stakeholder management skills, including influencing & negotiating
  • advanced analytical and problem solving skills
  • strong communication & presentation skills, both verbal and written
  • experience working with complex organisations, preferably within the financial services and/or retail sector
  • a proven background of driving organisational change and influencing internal and external stakeholders
  • project and team management experience
  • experience in preparing, reviewing and communicating reporting/presentations to senior leadership
  • a broad range of finance experience, including strong accounting knowledge, commercial decision support and FP&A
  • a continuous improvement mindset and track record of execution


Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To
  • provide financial and commercial support to the Coles Financial Services business and Financial Services leadership team
  • lead and coordinate financial result delivery, as well as planning and reporting
  • act as the technical accounting subject matter expert for CFS
  • development and management of direct reports

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.

As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

Benefits

If that isn’t exciting enough, as a team member at Coles you:
  • will receive a staff discount and exclusive team member offers
  • can enjoy a convenience store located onsite

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same – our customer first strategy. We have over 112,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please Note

842431933:
[

Case Manager

Company Name EML (Employers Mutual Limited) Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organisation that specialises in Workers Compensation. Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?


  • Melbourne Office
  • Manage a portfolio of claims
  • Excellent opportunity for career progression and growth


Established in 1910, EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company with offices throughout Australia. Managing workers compensation claims across different industries, we are a dynamic company who has grown from 50 to 1,500 staff in the last 10 years. With this rapid growth means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate. For over 100 years, the people of Australia have put their trust in EML for their workers compensation needs.


THE OPPORTUNITY


You will play a critical role in pro-actively and effectively managing a portfolio of claims and helping people get their lives back after injury or illness.

This position requires a focus on providing excellent customer service and proactive strategic direction of injured workers current and future requirements. It operates within a deadline-driven team environment, relying on pro-active, timely and effective management of a portfolio of claims.

The primary focus of this position is to enhance injury and claims management outcomes and the safe and sustainable return to work of injured workers. In this role, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:


  • Adopt a service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of workers and employers
  • Ensure that active and timely intervention occurs to improve recovery and return to work outcomes
  • Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders
  • Assist the worker and employer with the claim process and providing support in the completion of relevant documents to ensure timely access to required services to support return to work and injury recovery
  • Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim costs


ABOUT YOU


We're looking for people with a passion to make a positive difference and help people get their lives back.

To be successful in this role, you'll have proven skills and experience, including:


  • Customer Service and/or Office experience
  • High attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Effective communication and conflict resolution skills
  • Negotiation and influencing
  • Empathy and understanding
  • Provide excellent customer service and build strong collaborative relationships with our customers
  • Ability to earn trust in relationships with others by consistently demonstrating integrity and professional competence
  • Effectively listen and understand the needs of the customer and what is important to them to enable their recovery and return to work
  • Competent in the use of MS Word and MS Excel
  • Basic understanding of medical terminology


WHAT WE OFFER


We value our people and support them to do their best work by investing in their professional development. EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A vibrant, collaborative team culture

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Great work/life balance

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A corporate wellbeing program

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A reward & recognition program

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Comprehensive learning and development support

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Fast-track career opportunities

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Competitive salary packages

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 17.5% annual leave loading


We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. You'll find our supportive culture, rewards and career development makes EML a company you’ll want to be a part of. To find out more, contact Katherine Romano on 03 7000 0935 or email k.romano@eml.com.au

Asset Management Engineer
Job ID: 553240
Job type: Full Time - Permanent
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Engineering (All disciplines), Construction

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Position Summary

Downer's Road Division is one of the largest non-government owned infrastructure services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 40,000 km of roads Australia wide. Downer is involved in many exciting ventures within the civil road industry throughout the country.

Due to continued business growth we have an early career opportunity within The Asset Management Services Team. This team supports our Road Network Management business and is critical to the ongoing success and development of this growing business. This team provides support over three core functions; Asset Management Services, Information System Development and Support and Business Reporting.

Ideally you are keen to develop a long term career within road asset management with an industry leader. You will enjoy working in a collaborative team that supports ongoing career growth and provides an engaging working environment.

About You
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Civil Engineering or related disciplines
  • Exposure to civil construction would be highly advantageous but not essential
  • Have a willingness and enthusiasm to learn all aspects of our operations
  • An understanding of planning, execution and reporting of projects
  • Be outcome focused and have strong communication, organisational and problem solving skills
  • Some demonstrated ability to work with people both in a team and autonomously
  • Good communication and organisational skills
  • Proficient computer skills in particular Project and Excel
  • Strong safety focus with demonstrated evidence of actively promoting and sustaining a Zero harm environment


What We Offer
  • Highly supportive, team orientated organisation
  • A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors
  • Competitive remuneration with on-going training and support
  • A long-term career opportunity for working with an ASX listed company

For more information please contact: Helen Kruimel – Talent & Sourcing Business Partner, Infrastructure Services, mobile number 0409 072 562

How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply now button

Downer does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from Recruitment Agencies. Please do not submit any resumes or associated profiles to the Downer careers portal or to any Downer employees. Downer will not pay any placement fees relating to unsolicited resume referrals.
